intro: Armeriastrum horridum, commonly known as the rough armeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This perennial herb is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as plains and slopes. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to withstand drought conditions.
